definition: to hunger for sth (idiom); eagerly/to long for sth
as/as if/such as
hungry
variant of 飢|饥[ji1]
to seem/to appear/to resemble/similar/-like/pseudo-/(more) than
old variant of 似[si4]
see 似的[shi4 de5]
thirsty

sentences.english: Five-year-olds seem to have an unquenchable thirst for knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 五岁孩子似乎都有如饥似渴的求知欲。

sentences.english: He read throught the newspaper thirstily.
sentences.chinese: 他如饥似渴地读着报纸。

sentences.english: I gave him a glass of water and the drank it thirstily .
sentences.chinese: 我给了他一杯水，他如饥似渴地把它喝掉了。

sentences.english: I noticed a small boy, delicate of bone and feature, ragged but clean, hungrily appraising a basket of freshly picked green peas.
sentences.chinese: 他如饥似渴地玩赏着一篮新采摘下来的绿豌豆。

sentences.english: He read through the newspaper thirstily.
sentences.chinese: 他如饥似渴地读着报纸。

definition: lit. always with a book in hand (idiom)/fig. (of a student or scholar) diligent and hardworking
as if gaining the most precious treasure
lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth/also written 如癡如醉|如痴如醉[ru2 chi1 ru2 zui4]
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
to read (honorific: e.g. your distinguished article)
with keen interest (idiom)/with great pleasure/with gusto/eagerly
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
to swallow in one gulp (idiom)/(fig.) to accept without thinking/to lap up
to long for/to crave for/to greatly desire
to concentrate one's attention (idiom)
anxious to learn/keen for knowledge
with single-hearted devotion (idiom)
vast as the open sea (idiom); fig. extensive (library)
diligent and tireless (idiom)
